        public boolean isValid(int x,
              int y)
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of a position
        y - coordinate of a position
        Returns:
        if the given position can be reachable and was not visited before, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.

      • isFinal

        public boolean isFinal(int x,
              int y)
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of a position
        y - coordinate of a position
        Returns:
        if the given position is exit of maze, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.

      • solveMaze

        private void solveMaze()

        Starts a loop to find the end of maze.
        Pops the top element of Stack<Position> memo, then checks if the popped position is exit of maze.

        If the finish position is reached, breaks the loop, and prints a info message.

        Otherwise, checks the consecutive neighbors of popped positions, and pushes valid positions to Stack<Position> memo.
        Then repeats the loop.

        If Stack<Position> memo becomes empty at the end of a loop, that means there is no solution.
        So, breaks the loop, and prints a info message.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException, - If start position is wall.
        Requires:
        Start position (0,0) cannot be wall.

      • check

        private void check(int x,
         int y)
        Checks a position, if the position is valid, and pushes it to Stack<Position> memo.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of a position
        y - coordinate of a position

      • isDeadEnd

        private boolean isDeadEnd(int x,

      • getSolution

        public int[][] getSolution()
        Starts the solving procedure of maze. Then converts two dimensional Position array to a two dimensional integer array.
        Returns:
        If solution was found, returns the result maze array as two dimensional integer array. The path is marked as -1.
